comment.author: 35687899@N00
comment._content: Alfred Deakin (3 August 1856 – 7 October 1919), Australian politician, was a leader of the movement for Australian federation and later the second Prime Minister of Australia. In the last quarter of the nineteenth century, Deakin was a major contributor to the establishment of liberal reforms in the colony of Victoria, including the protection of rights at work. He also played a major part in establishing irrigation in Australia. It is likely that he could have been Premier of Victoria, but he chose to devote his energy to federation. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Alfred_Deakin

comment.author: 35014516@N03
comment._content: manfire: Thanks for the additional info. on Deakin.  We'll include some of it next time we update our description.
